Colorectal cancer (CRC) is the third leading cause of cancer-related deaths in men and in women. It is expected to cause about 53,200 deaths during 2020
1 . Treatments against CRC are surgery, drugs (hormonal therapy and chemotherapy), radiation, and/or immunotherapy. For patients with CRC, chemotherapy remains the most common treatment. However, it is often followed by tumour relapse and acquired chemotherapy-resistance. An effective drug for therapy and prognosis after surgery still does not exist
